channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The choices facing Putin in Belarus are all fraught with risk
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has been an extraordinary outlier in the monumental change that has swept through the former Soviet Union -- for 26 years, he's remained the pre-eminent figure in his impoverished country. Meanwhile, aging central Asian dictators have died or stepped aside, Russian President Vladimir Putin has weathered oligarchs, dissidents and sanctions, and neighboring Ukraine has seen two revolutions and a civil war.

item.title: Car bomb and gun attack hit popular hotel in Somali capital
item.description: A car bomb went off at the gate of the beachfront Elite Hotel in the Somali capital Mogadishu on Sunday afternoon, Col Ahmed Hashi, a Somali police officer told CNN, in an ongoing attack that has killed at least one person.

item.title: Jared Kushner asked about 'birther' attack on Kamala Harris
item.description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour talks to Jared Kushner about Trump and the recent birtherism attack on presumptive Democratic vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris.

item.title: Tens of thousands gather in Minsk to protest, as Lukashenko holds rival demonstration
item.description: An enormous crowd of protesters gathered in Minsk Sunday to demand a new presidential election in Belarus, while the embattled President Alexander Lukashenko held a smaller rival demonstration nearby.

item.title: Trump's finger-pointing is latest attempt to rewrite history in real time
item.description: • ANALYSIS: The sign that Trump is a weak candidate • ANALYSIS: Biden heads into conventions in historically strong position

item.title: Robert Trump, the younger brother of President Donald Trump, dead at age 72
item.description: Robert Trump, 72, the younger brother of President Donald Trump, died Saturday at a New York hospital, Donald Trump announced in a statement.

item.title: Boris Johnson may be taught a cruel lesson by Covid-19 in bid to reopen schools
item.description: Schools or pubs? That's the choice some believe UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson will face when English students return to their classrooms next month. The country has only recently been able to open establishments like pubs and restaurants, which suffered badly during lockdown.

item.title: Biden heads into the conventions in a historically strong position
item.description: First things first: The theme song of the week is The Nanny.

item.title: Lebanese President says it's 'impossible' for him to resign following Beirut's deadly blast
item.description: Lebanese President Michel Aoun has said it would be "impossible" for him to resign following calls for him to leave office over the deadly explosion in Beirut.

item.title: Sevilla strike late to beat Manchester United and advance to Europa League final
item.description: Sevilla overcame Manchester United thanks to a late goal to reach the final of the Europa League, winning 2-1 in Cologne, Germany.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton dominates to win Spanish GP and extend lead atop F1 standings
item.description: Lewis Hamilton produced a dominant display to win the Spanish Grand Prix and extend his lead at the top of the Formula One standings.

item.title: South Korea orders thousands of church members to be tested
Fishermen rescue women stuck at sea for 15 hours
item.description: Two young women survived 15 hours at sea after going missing while paddle boarding in Galway, Ireland. They were found the next day clinging to a lobster pot buoy by a local father and son fishermen duo. CNN affiliate Virgin Media News has the story.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
A cargo ship leaking tons of oil off an island coast has split in two
item.description: A ship that has leaked tons of oil off the coast of Mauritius has split apart, authorities said on Saturday.

item.title: Trump risks fracturing the global internet by banning TikTok and WeChat
item.description: For years, the Great Firewall of China has blocked some of the largest online services coming out of the United States, including Google, Facebook and Twitter.

item.title: Men on death row for murder of British backpackers in Thailand get sentence commuted
item.description: Two men on death row for killing pair of British backpackers on a Thai island in 2014 have had their death sentences commuted to life imprisonment by the country's king.

item.title: Trump says snapback sanctions against Iran could come next week
item.description: President Donald Trump said snapback sanctions against Iran could happen as soon as next week after the UN Security Council rejected a US proposal to extend the conventional weapons embargo on Friday.

item.title: The wild tigers that terrorized Hong Kong
item.description: In 1929, two Chinese farmers were stopped by a British police officer while ambling down a road in a rugged part of Hong Kong's then-expansive rural hinterland.

item.title: What Kamala Harris means to Indian Americans
item.description: Kamala Harris, the daughter of Indian and Jamaican immigrants, became the first Black and South Asian American woman to run on a major political party's presidential ticket after presumptive nominee Joe Biden announced her as his VP pick on Tuesday.

item.title: Man in critical condition after stabbing at Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas
item.description: A man was taken to the hospital in critical condition after a stabbing at the Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas on Saturday night, according to Las Vegas Metro Police Department spokesman Lt. Frank Humel.

item.title: An Australian surfer punched a great white shark to save a woman being attacked
item.description: An Australian surfer repeatedly punched a great white shark to save his female companion who was being attacked by the animal in New South Wales state on Saturday.

item.title: Lyon stun Manchester City to reach Champions League semifinals
item.description: Lyon stunned Manchester City on Saturday to qualify for the semifinals of the Champions League, winning 3-1.

item.title: A rare fire tornado is spotted near a blaze in California
item.description: 2020 has reached into its bag of tricks again and tossed out another surprise -- this time in the form of a swirling fire. Or as meteorologists call it, a firenado -- short for fire tornado.

item.title: Taylor Swift has a message for her fans: Vote early
'Clueless' is getting series reboot with a twist
item.description: "Clueless" is coming back, and this time, the spotlight is on Dionne Davenport.

item.title: India cricket legend MS Dhoni announces retirement
item.description: India cricket legend MS Dhoni announced his retirement from international competition on Saturday, marking the end to his 16-year career with the India National Team.

item.title: Barca star insists: The club needs change
item.description: After losing 3-0 to Roma in 2018, Barcelona fans might've thought it was the club's lowest ebb. After losing 4-0 to Liverpool in 2019, they might've thought it was actually the club's lowest point.

item.title: Did Fortnite just kill the App Store as we know it?
item.description: Fortnite maker Epic Games sent shockwaves through the tech industry this week when it sued Apple and Google, claiming both companies' app stores are monopolies. If Epic were to win the lawsuits, Apple and Google could be required to overhaul their businesses by making their app stores more favorable to developers.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds asks young people to stop 'dangerous' partying during pandemic
item.description: Ryan Reynolds has one simple request for young Canadians in British Columbia: Please don't kill his mom.

item.title: Take a look inside Tokyo's drive-in haunted house
item.description: A Japanese performance group has created an experience that follows social distancing guidelines yet remains absolutely terrifying -- a drive-in haunted house.

item.title: Overcrowded, overpriced and overwhelmed. The UK's Covid-19 staycation nightmare
item.description: Beaches strewn with waste, wild campers destroying fragile habitats, warnings from an increasingly overstretched Coastguard, unaffordable accommodations. What was supposed to have been a Great British summer has, for many, become a staycation nightmare.

item.title: Pandemic power play: It's China vs. US in Latin America
item.description: At first glance, the picture China's ambassador to Barbados tweeted on July 23 shows nothing more than an online meeting — a typical, screen-based representation of what life has become during the pandemic.

item.title: Georgia State Patrol trooper charged with murder after shooting a Black man
item.description: A Georgia State Patrol trooper has been arrested and charged with felony murder after fatally shooting a Black man during an attempted traffic stop.

item.title: Chef José Andrés helps feed people in Beirut after deadly explosion
item.description: Anderson Cooper talks with Chef José Andrés, who is in Beirut with World Central Kitchen helping feed people after the deadly explosion. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

item.title: How these images changed a woman's family history
item.description: Her uncle's decision to fight in World War II horrified his conservative Mennonite family, who rarely spoke of him even after his death. She discovers the truth about his service decades later.

item.title: A 12-year-old girl was caught on camera gambling at an Australian casino
item.description: A 12-year-old girl was among three minors caught gambling at a casino in Sydney, Australia, regulators said Saturday.

item.title: Resident: Why should we leave Beirut to crooks and thieves?
item.description: Reports of the demise of Beirut are greatly exaggerated. This year has brought economic devastation, the coronavirus pandemic, civil unrest, political instability and a blast many residents liken to the bombing of Hiroshima. Yet residents tell CNN's Ben Wedeman they, and their city, will rise again.

item.title: Lifelong Republican: I'm voting Biden because I'm disgusted
item.description: Some Republicans voters in Arizona say they are dissatisfied with the way President Trump has handled the response to coronavirus pandemic and are organizing to defeat him in 2020. CNN's Miguel Marquez reports.

item.title: Brazil's Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugarloaf Mountain reopen Saturday
item.description: Two of Brazil's best known tourist attractions -- the Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugarloaf Mountain -- have reopened after being shut for five months due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: We landed dream jobs as caretakers of an Irish island -- then Covid struck
item.description: It was Valentine's Day this year that Dublin couple Annie Birney and Eoin Boyle found out they'd landed what might just be the world's most romantic job.

item.title: Pentagon to start investigating UFO sightings
item.description: The Pentagon has formed a new task force to investigate UFO sightings observed by the US military, according to defense officials.

item.title: The Man Utd teenager who is a superstar in the making
item.description: There was a period during the winter of 2008 when every Saturday night Paul Newsham's Yorkshire home would sound like old telephone exchange switch room.

item.title: Dramatic aerial photos showcase China's wild 'crimson beach'
item.description: No bathing suits are required to enjoy this Chinese beach.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen unveils baby bump
item.description: Supermodel Chrissy Teigen displayed her baby bump in a social media post, confirming that she's expecting her third child with John Legend.

item.title: Why I quit Google to clean up India's lakes
item.description: When Arun Krishnamurthy was a teenager, he witnessed a pond near his home in the suburbs of Chennai, India, fill up with trash.

item.title: 'Fox eyes': Harmless makeup trend or cultural appropriation?
item.description: "Ching chong eyes!" That's what elementary school kids used to call Sophie Wang. It was an insidious racist slur casually thrown around as they mocked her Asian ethnicity while pulling on the corner of their eyes. Upward for Japanese. To the side for Chinese. Downward for Korean.

item.title: Belarus leader calls Putin to reaffirm mutual cooperation, later rejects foreign mediation offers
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Saturday rejected foreign mediation offers to help stabilize the volatile situation in his country. But reached out to Russian President Vladimir Putin with a call, and both men expressed confidence that the situation would "be resolved soon," according to a read out of the call published by the Kremlin.

item.title: What's stopping Putin from expanding further?
item.description: With mass protests erupting in Belarus over a disputed presidential election on Sunday, after which incumbent Alexander Lukashenko claimed a landslide victory, the Kremlin must be watching nervously.

item.title: Major US diplomatic push to counter Russia may be in jeopardy amid Belarus unrest
item.description: As Belarus is roiled by a government crackdown on peaceful demonstrators protesting an election condemned by the international community, a casualty of the unrest may be a nascent diplomatic push by the Trump administration to improve ties with Minsk as part of an effort to counter Russia's one-time dominant position there.
